page.title: 08EDUCATION IN PETWORTH RURAL
page.content: There are no schools in the area covered. Children attending State schools and living over two miles from them are transported by bus. Mixed-sex primary schools for ages five to eleven are at Kirdford, Fittleworth and Wisborough Green. From eleven to sixteen, and eighteen if studying for entry to colleges or universities, children attend big comprehensive schools such as the Weald School, Billinghurst, which caters for about 1,500, brought from all parts of the County by coaches. These schools have their own computer centres and cover a wide variety of subjects. The school's facilities are used by the local community after school hours. Children attending private, fee-paying schools may be day pupils or boarders, either weekly or for a term. These schools are usually for one sex only.
